alert.note: Alert for Hitchcock (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 29 at 7:13PM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Hitchcock and northeastern Dundy Counties through 700 PM MDT/800 PM CDT/... At 612 PM MDT/712 PM CDT/, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 6 miles southwest of Wauneta, or 16 miles southeast of Imperial, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northwestern Hitchcock and northeastern Dundy Counties. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
